fields.name: Aberrant Resilience
fields.desc: The aboleth is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the aboleth fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Probing Telepathy
fields.desc: If a creature the aboleth can see communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires.

fields.name: Slime Pox
fields.desc:
Characterized by the slimy pustules that erupt across the victim's body, _slime pox_ is a disease that infects creatures attacked by an aboleth or that come into contact with an aboleth's slime. Until the disease is cured, the infected creature can breathe air and water, can't regain HP except when underwater, and takes 6 (1d12) acid damage for every 1 hour it remains outside of water or without moisture applied to its skin. Every 24 hours that elapse, the infected creature must make a DC 16 CHA save. Each time a creature fails this save, it views the infecting aboleth more and more favorably, becoming the aboleth's doting and protective thrall after three failed saves.
The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive, but once a creature has acquired three of a kind, it no longer has to make this save, resulting in either the creature becoming a thrall of the aboleth or an autonomous - though infected - creature. _Slime pox_ can be cured only by the heal spell or similar magic.

fields.name: Slimy Skin
fields.desc: The aboleth is coated in an otherworldly mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 16 CON save or be infected with _slime pox_ (see the Slime Pox trait).

fields.name: Divine Providence
fields.desc: Each friendly creature within 20 feet of the acolyte that isn't a Construct or Undead has advantage on death saves.

fields.name: Acidic Vapors
fields.desc: After the black dragon uses its Acid Breath, acid clings to its mouth, throat, and nostrils for a time, evaporating as the dragon breathes. While the dragon's Acid Breath is unavailable, acidic vapors surround it, and each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 18 CON save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Charged Hide
fields.desc: When the blue dragon hasn't exhaled its Lightning Breath, the electric charge builds up across its body. While the dragon's Lightning Breath is available, it emits wild sparks of electricity, and each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 19 CON save or be incapacitated until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.desc: After the green dragon exhales its Poison Breath, wisps of poisonous gas laced with the alchemical taint that permeates the dragon's body linger around it. While the dragon's Poison Breath is unavailable, each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 18 WIS save or be terrified, as the gas causes the creature to experience frightful hallucinations. A terrified creature is frightened, and its speed is reduced to 0.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Boil Over
fields.desc: When the red dragon hasn't unleashed its Fire Breath, the heat builds and rolls outward from it. While the dragon's Fire Breath is available, it emits immense heat, and each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 21 CON save or take 7 (2d6) fire damage. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more also suffers one level of exhaustion.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Freezing Fog
fields.desc: As the **young silver dragon**, except it affects creatures within 20 feet of the dragon, and the save DC is 20.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Ice Walk
fields.desc: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. In addition, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Numbing Chill
fields.desc: When the white dragon hasn't unleashed its Cold Breath, the cold builds up within it and ripples outward from it. While the dragon's Cold Breath is available, it emits a numbing chill, and each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 19 CON save or its speed is reduced by 15 feet.

fields.name: Air Form
fields.desc: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Cloud Camouflage
fields.desc: The elemental's Stealth is 20 while in clouds, fog, or windy weather.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Elemental Resilience
fields.desc: The elemental is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Fey Resilience
fields.desc: The ambush hag is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The hag can mimic Animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 16 WIS (Insight) check.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The ambush hag can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Inscrutable
fields.desc: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. WIS (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

fields.name: Magical Claws
fields.desc: The sphinx's Claw attacks are magical. When the sphinx hits with a Claw attack, the Claw deals an extra 2d8 force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The sphinx is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
fields.desc: The armor is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by _dispel magic_, the armor must succeed on a CON save against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The armor doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Construct Resilience
fields.desc: The armor is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the armor remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The ankheg is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Nature's Champion
fields.desc: While the archdruid is conscious, wearing no armor, and in a natural environment or terrain, such as a desert, forest, or mountain, it adds its WIS modifier to its AC (included above). In addition, it is resistant to cold, fire, lightning, poison, and thunder damage.

fields.name: Nature's Weapons
fields.desc: When the archdruid hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage (included in the attack), the archdruid's choice.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The archmage has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Ward
fields.desc: While the archmage is conscious, wearing no armor, and not inside of an antimagic effect, it adds its INT modifier to its AC (included above). In addition, it is resistant to force damage.

fields.name: Evasion
fields.desc: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a DEX save to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save, and only half damage if it fails.

fields.name: Poisoned Weapons
fields.desc:
The assassin's weapons are coated in poison. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 poison damage (included in the attack). In addition, at the start of each of its turns, the assassin can choose which of the following poisons is active on its weapons. The poison remains on the weapons until the start of the assassin's next turn.
- **Assassin's Friend.** A creature poisoned by a weapon coated with this poison takes an extra 4 (1d8) poison damage each time it takes damage while poisoned.
- **Buyer's Mercy.** A creature poisoned by a weapon coated with this poison falls unconscious while poisoned or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.
- **Meddler's Fate.** A creature poisoned by a weapon coated with this poison has its speed halved while poisoned.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the shrub remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal shrub.

fields.name: Plant Resilience
fields.desc: The shrub is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

fields.name: Plant Resilience
fields.desc: The tree is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Heated Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the azer or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Heated Weapons
fields.desc: When the azer hits with a metal melee weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Illumination
fields.desc: The azer sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The baboon has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the baboon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Grumpy
fields.desc: When in combat, the badger attacks the creature that most recently dealt damage to it, provided that creature is within range or moving to it doesn't cause the badger to provoke opportunity attacks. The badger otherwise attacks the nearest hostile creature.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The badger's Perception is 16 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Grumpy
fields.desc: When in combat, the badger attacks the creature that most recently dealt damage to it, provided that creature is within range or moving to it doesn't cause the badger to provoke opportunity attacks. The badger otherwise attacks the nearest hostile creature.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The badger's Perception is 16 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Terrifying Luminance
fields.desc: When a creature that can see the balara's glowing ribcage starts its turn within 30 feet of the balara, the balara can force it to make a DC 14 WIS save if the balara isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. On a failure, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn, as the visions, fear, and pain of the last moments of several animals flash through its mind. While frightened, the creature's speed is reduced to 0, and it can't use reactions. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the save at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the balara until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the balara in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The balara doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The balara is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Demonic Flames
fields.desc: Creatures resistant to fire damage aren't resistant to fire damage dealt by the balor. Creatures immune to fire damage are still immune to the balor's fire damage.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The balor is resistant to cold and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Diving Assault
fields.desc: If the balor is flying and moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 20 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the balor can make one Longsword attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Fire Aura
fields.desc: At the start of each of the balor's turns, each creature within 10 feet of it takes 13 (3d8) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite.

fields.name: Flaming Weapons
fields.desc: The balor's weapon attacks are magical. When the balor hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 fire damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The balor has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Opportunist
fields.desc: The bandit captain has advantage on opportunity attacks.

fields.name: Opportunist
fields.desc: The bandit has advantage on opportunity attacks.

fields.name: Barbed Death
fields.desc: When the barbed devil dies, its body withers, leaving behind a mass of spikes on the ground in a 10-foot radius centered on the devil's body. The area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute, and when a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 2d6 piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

fields.name: Barbed Hide
fields.desc: A creature that hits the barbed devil with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) piercing damage. A creature that starts its turn grappling or grappled by the barbed devil takes 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

fields.name: Devilish Resilience
fields.desc: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Devil's Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Artistic Expression
fields.desc: The bard has one primary form of artistic expression, such as song, poetry, dance, fashion, paint, or similar. It is resistant to one type of damage associated with that artistic expression. For example, a bard expressing art through song or oration is resistant to thunder damage, a bard expressing art through paint is resistant to acid or poison damage (the bard's choice), and a bard expressing art through witty discourse or clever quips is resistant to psychic damage. This trait can't make the bard resistant to force, necrotic, or radiant damage.

fields.name: Expressive Weapons
fields.desc: When the bard hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 damage of the type determined by Artistic Expression.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The basilisk is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Petrifying Gaze
fields.desc: When a creature that can see the basilisk's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk, the basilisk can force it to make a DC 12 CON save if the basilisk isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. On a failure, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the save at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the save at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. If the basilisk sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the basilisk mistakes itself for a rival and is affected by its own gaze.

fields.name: Echolocation
fields.desc: The bat can't use its keensense while deafened.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing
fields.desc: The bat's Perception is 16 when perceiving by hearing.

fields.name: Cacophonous Swarm
fields.desc: A creature in the swarm's space that casts a spell with a verbal component must succeed on a DC 12 CON save or the spell fails to cast, expending the action required to cast it but not the spell slot or daily use.

fields.name: Echolocation
fields.desc: The swarm can't use its keensense while deafened.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing
fields.desc: The swarm's Perception is 16 when perceiving by hearing.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bat. The swarm can't regain HP or gain temporary HP.

fields.name: Swarm Resilience
fields.desc: The swarm is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it is immune to the charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, and stunned conditions.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing

fields.name: Show Mettle
fields.desc: While it can see a superior devil, such as a barbed devil, pit fiend, or similar, the bearded devil has advantage on saves against being charmed and frightened.

fields.name: Lightning Absorption
fields.desc: Whenever the behir is subjected to lighting damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The behir is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Reckless
fields.desc: At the start of its turn, the berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Stalwart
fields.desc: If the berserker starts its turn afflicted by an ongoing effect that allows for a repeated save to end the effect, such as the hold spell or the poison from an ettercap's Bite, the gladiator can make the save at the start of the turn instead of the end and has advantage on the save.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the dragon moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the dragon can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Corrosive Form
fields.desc: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through a panel of nonmagical wood or metal in its space that is up to 2 inches thick in 1 round.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: The pudding doesn't require sleep.

fields.name: Ooze Resilience
fields.desc: The pudding is resistant to the restrained condition, and it is immune to exhaustion and to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and prone conditions.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Charge

fields.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
fields.desc: If the boar takes 10 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 HP, it is reduced to 1 HP instead.

fields.name: Charge

fields.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
fields.desc: If the boar takes 4 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 HP, it is reduced to 1 HP instead.

fields.name: Brutal
fields.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Brutal
fields.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The bulette is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The bulette's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Camel Resilience
fields.desc: The camel is resistant to exhaustion, and it requires only half the amount of water that a typical Beast of its size needs.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The cat's Perception is 18 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The centaur is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Trampling Charge
fields.desc: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Pike attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the centaur can make one Hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Devilish Resilience
fields.desc: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Devil's Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Bickering Heads
fields.desc:
The chimera is perpetually one step away from arguing with itself. A creature that can see the chimera can use a bonus action on its turn to appeal to one of the chimera's heads with bribes (dragon), praise (lion), displays of magic (goat), or other clever manipulation of a head's desires. The chimera must succeed on a DC 15 WIS save or succumb to that desire.
If the lion or goat head succumbs, the chimera has disadvantage on the next Bite or Headbutt attack it makes before the end of its next turn. If the dragon head succumbs, creatures caught in the chimera's next Fire Breath have advantage on the save, provided the chimera uses the breath within the next 1 minute. Once a head has succumbed to a desire, that head can't succumb again for the next 24 hours.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The chimera is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Multiple Heads
fields.desc: The chimera has three heads and is resistant to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Aberrant Resilience
fields.desc: The chuul is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The chuul can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Sense Magic
fields.desc: The chuul senses and can pinpoint the location of magic within 120 feet of it. If it senses magic and can see the creature or object bearing the magic it senses, it sees a faint aura around that creature or object.

fields.name: Acid Absorption
fields.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains HP equal to the acid damage dealt.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Fire Weakness
fields.desc: When the clay golem takes fire damage, its body temporarily hardens like baked clay. Until the end of its next turn, the golem's speed is reduced by 10 feet, it can't use Mold Hand, and its AC becomes 18.

fields.name: Golem Resilience
fields.desc: The golem is immune to poison and psychic damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: Aberrant Resilience
fields.desc: The cloaker is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

fields.name: Damage Transfer
fields.desc: While attached to a creature, the cloaker takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and that creature takes the other half.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the cloaker remains motionless without its underside exposed, it is indistinguishable from a dark leather cloak.

fields.name: Light Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in bright light, the cloaker has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 6 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Cloudsight
fields.desc: The cloud giant can see through areas obscured by clouds, fog, smoke, and steam without penalty.

fields.name: Giant Attributes
fields.desc: The cloud giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The cloud giant's Perception is 22 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The cockatrice is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the dragon moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the dragon can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Celestial Resilience
fields.desc: The couatl is resistant to radiant damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

fields.name: Inscrutable
fields.desc: The couatl is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as divination spells or effects, such as scrying or detecting its location, that it refuses. WIS (Insight) checks made to ascertain the couatl's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The couatl has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: The couatl's weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The crab can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The crab can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The crimson jelly can move through space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Blood Sense
fields.desc: The crimson jelly can pinpoint, by scent, the location of creatures that aren't Constructs or Undead and that don't have all of their HP within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: The crimson jelly doesn't require sleep.

fields.name: Ooze Resilience
fields.desc: The crimson jelly is resistant to the restrained condition, and it is immune to exhaustion and to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and prone conditions.

fields.name: Tainted Attacks
fields.desc: A creature that is reduced to 0 HP by a crimson jelly must succeed on a DC 9 CHA save or suffer one level of exhaustion. While a creature suffers from this exhaustion, it loses most of its memories aside from basic information about itself, such as its name and its capabilities, and it is wracked with nightmarish visions that include a crimson rune.

fields.name: Transparent
fields.desc: While in an area of dim or bright light, the crimson jelly is invisible. While in darkness, creatures without darkvision can see the jelly's faint crimson glow.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The crocodile can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

fields.name: Dark Devotion
fields.desc: The fanatic is resistant to the charmed and frightened conditions.

fields.name: Unholy Weapons
fields.desc: The fanatic's weapons are coated in dark, magical flames. When the fanatic hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 fire damage or necrotic damage (included in the attack), the fanatic's choice.

fields.name: Dark Devotion
fields.desc: The cultist is resistant to the charmed and frightened conditions.

fields.name: Echolocation
fields.desc: The darkmantle can't use its keensense while deafened.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation, such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

fields.name: Jagged Hide
fields.desc: A creature that hits the darkmantle with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The darkmantle is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The death dog is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Multiple Heads
fields.desc: The death dog has two heads and is resistant to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Disgraced Rejuvenation
fields.desc: Unless redeemed, a destroyed death knight returns in 1d4 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again within 10 feet of where it died.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The death knight has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The death knight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The death knight is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Gnome Cunning
fields.desc: The deep gnome has advantage on INT, WIS, and CHA saves against magic.

fields.name: Stone Camouflage
fields.desc: The deep gnome's Stealth is 17 while in rocky terrain.

fields.name: Angelic Resilience
fields.desc: The deva is resistant to radiant damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed and frightened conditions.

fields.name: Angelic Senses
fields.desc: The deva can pinpoint the location of Aberrations, Celestials, Fiends, and Undead within 30 feet of it and knows if a place or object it can sense is consecrated or desecrated.

fields.name: Angelic Weapons
fields.desc: The deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Immortal Nature
fields.desc: The deva doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The deva has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Reviving Prayer
fields.desc: The deva spends 10 minutes praying to its deity for the safe return of the soul of a slain creature. At the end of the prayer, the deva touches a creature that has been dead no more than 24 hours and returns the creature to life with a number of HP equal to half its HP maximum. Reviving Prayer can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts. A creature restored to life in this way can't be returned to life by this deva again for 30 days.

fields.name: Nebulous (Cloud Form Only)
fields.desc: The djinni's Stealth is 21, it can hover while flying, can't manipulate objects or attack, and it can pass through any space air can pass through without squeezing. In addition, it can enter and hide in any Tiny or larger container, such as a pouch, lamp, backpack, or barrel.

fields.name: Convincing Mimicry (Humanoid Form Only)
fields.desc: The doppelganger can mimic any Humanoid's body and voice it has seen and heard nearly perfectly. A creature very familiar with the individual Humanoid the doppelganger is pretending to be can tell the doppelganger is an imitation with a successful DC 20 WIS (Insight) check.

fields.name: Revealed Intentions
fields.desc: While reading a creature's mind, the doppelganger has advantage on CHA checks against the creature, knows the creature's current mood, and knows if the creature speaks a lie. In addition, the doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against the creature.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The dragon turtle deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Abyssal Rejuvenation
fields.desc: Unlike other outsiders, a dretch that dies in its home plane of the Abyss is restored in a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears in a random location in the Abyss. Only sprinkling holy water on the dretch's remains can prevent this trait from functioning.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The dretch is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Fey Ancestry
fields.desc: The drider is resistant to the charmed condition, and magic can't put the drider to sleep.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The drider is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 10 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Web Sense
fields.desc: While in contact with a web, the drider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

fields.name: Web Walker
fields.desc: The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

fields.name: Fey Ancestry
fields.desc: The drow is resistant to the charmed condition, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 7 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Fey Resilience
fields.desc: The dryad is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The dryad has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: One with the Forest
fields.desc: While in a forest, the dryad can't be surprised, and it leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.

fields.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
fields.desc: The dryad can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Tree Stride
fields.desc: Once on its turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within its reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or larger.

fields.name: Duergar Resilience
fields.desc: The duergar is resistant to the charmed and paralyzed conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells and illusions.

fields.name: Reduce
fields.desc: If the duergar starts its turn enlarged, it can choose to end the effect and return to its normal size (no action required).

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 5 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Death Burst
fields.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of dust. Each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 11 DEX save or be blinded for 1 minute. A blinded creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the mephit remains motionless and hovering, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary cloud of dust.

fields.name: Heightened Sight
fields.desc: The eagle's Perception is 19 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Seabird
fields.desc: The eagle can swim up to 40 feet on its turn, but it must start and end its movement either flying or on a solid surface, such as a ship or beach. If it is swimming at the end of its turn, it must succeed on a DC 11 CON save or it immediately begins to sink and suffocate. A suffocating eagle must succeed on a DC 13 STR check to fly out of the substance where it is sinking.

fields.name: Heightened Sight
fields.desc: The eagle's Perception is 19 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Seabird
fields.desc: The eagle can swim up to 30 feet on its turn, but it must start and end its movement either flying or on a solid surface, such as a ship or beach. If it is swimming at the end of its turn, it must succeed on a DC 10 CON save or it immediately begins to sink and suffocate. A suffocating eagle must succeed on a DC 8 STR check to fly out of the substance where it is sinking.

fields.name: Earth Glide
fields.desc: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material through which it moves.

fields.name: Earthen Camouflage
fields.desc: The elemental's Stealth is 14 while in muddy, rocky, sandy, or stony terrain.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Elemental Resilience
fields.desc: The elemental is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Nebulous (Cloud Form Only)
fields.desc: The efreeti's Stealth is 16, it can hover while flying, can't manipulate objects or attack, and it can pass through any space air can pass through without squeezing. In addition, it can enter and hide in any Tiny or larger container, such as a pouch, lamp, backpack, or barrel.

fields.name: Trampling Charge
fields.desc: If the elephant moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the elephant can make one Stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the elk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be knocked prone.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the elk moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 STR save or be knocked prone.

fields.name: Devilish Resilience
fields.desc: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Disciplined Fighter
fields.desc:
At the start of each of its turns, the erinyes chooses one of the following fighting styles to adopt, which lasts until the start of the erinyes's next turn.
- **Aggressive.** The erinyes has advantage on the first attack it makes on its turn, but the next attack roll against the erinyes has advantage.
- **Retributive.** The next time the erinyes is hit by a melee weapon attack from a creature within 5 feet of it, the erinyes can make one Longsword attack against the attacker (no action required).
- **Defensive.** The next time erinyes uses the Parry reaction, it takes only half the damage if the attack hits and regains 18 (4d8) HP if the attack doesn't hit.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The erinyes has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Poisonous Weapons
fields.desc: The erinyes's weapon attacks are magical. When the erinyes hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 poison damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The ettercap is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Web Sense
fields.desc: While in contact with a web, the ettercap knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

fields.name: Web Walker
fields.desc: The ettercap ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

fields.name: Giant Attributes
fields.desc: The ettin is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

fields.name: Multiple Heads
fields.desc: The ettin has two heads and is resistant to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Obstinate
fields.desc: The ettin has advantage on WIS and CHA saves.

fields.name: Wakeful
fields.desc: When one of the ettin's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

fields.name: Fey Resilience
fields.desc: The feral hunter is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Heightened Senses
fields.desc: The feral hunter's Perception is 19 when perceiving by sight, hearing, or smell.

fields.name: Precise
fields.desc: A weapon that deals piercing damage deals one extra die of its damage when the feral hunter hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Woodland Walk
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of nonmagical plants doesn't cost the feral hunter extra movement. In addition, the feral hunter can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The fire elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Elemental Resilience
fields.desc: The fire elemental is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Fire Camouflage
fields.desc: The fire elemental's Stealth is 18 while in a Medium or larger fire.

fields.name: Fire Form
fields.desc: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature must succeed on a DC 14 DEX save or take 5 (1d10) fire damage and catch fire; until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the burning creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

fields.name: Illumination
fields.desc: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

fields.name: Water Susceptibility
fields.desc: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

fields.name: Giant Attributes
fields.desc: The fire giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

fields.name: Aversion of Fire
fields.desc: If the golem takes fire damage, it loses its immunity to the frightened condition and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Berserk (55 HP or Fewer)
fields.desc: When the golem starts its turn, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its HP. The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC 15 CHA (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If the golem takes damage while still at 55 HP or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Flesh Golem Resilience
fields.desc: The golem is immune to poison damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Lightning Absorption
fields.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: Fey Resilience
fields.desc: The flinderbeast is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The flinderbeast's Perception 18 when perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
fields.desc: The sword is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by _dispel magic_, the sword must succeed on a CON save against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The sword doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Construct Resilience
fields.desc: The sword is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the sword remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal sword.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The frog can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The frog's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Toxic Skin
fields.desc: The frog's skin is coated in a hallucinogenic toxin. A creature that touches the frog or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a DC 13 CON save. On a failure, a creature is poisoned until the end of its next turn and experiences mild hallucinations while poisoned.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The frog can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The frog's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The frog can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The frog's long jump is up to 10 feet and its high jump is up to 5 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Giant Attributes
fields.desc: The frost giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

fields.name: Ice Walk
fields.desc: The frost giant can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. In addition, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

fields.name: Snowsight
fields.desc: The frost giant can see through areas obscured by snowfall, sleet, and other wintry precipitation without penalty.

fields.name: Diving Pounce
fields.desc: If the gargoyle is flying and moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claws attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the gargoyle can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the gargoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

fields.name: Ooze Cube
fields.desc:
The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but are subjected to the cube's Engulf and have disadvantage on the save. Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover. A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful DC 12 STR check, and the creature making the attempt takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.
The cube can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: The cube doesn't require sleep.

fields.name: Ooze Resilience
fields.desc: The cube is resistant to the grappled and restrained conditions, and it is immune to exhaustion and to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and prone conditions.

fields.name: Transparent
fields.desc: While motionless, the cube's Stealth is 15, even when the cube is in plain sight.

fields.name: Hungry Dead Nature
fields.desc: The ghast doesn't require air or sleep. In addition, it must consume at least 2 pounds of raw meat every 24 hours, or it loses its immunity to exhaustion and risks starvation until it does so. While it has any levels of exhaustion from starvation, the ghast can't remove levels of exhaustion until it consumes at least 4 pounds of raw meat.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The ghast can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Stench
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the ghast must succeed on a DC 13 CON save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature is immune to the ghast's Stench for 24 hours.

fields.name: Turning Defiance
fields.desc: The ghast and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saves against effects that turn undead.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The ghast is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Ethereal Sight
fields.desc: The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The ghost doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The ghost is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Unfinished Business
fields.desc: Unless its unfinished business is fulfilled, a destroyed ghost returns in 1d4 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again within 10 feet of where it died. If presented with an object or piece of information related to its unfinished business, the ghost must succeed on a DC 13 WIS save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn. After it has been incapacitated by a particular source, the ghost can't be incapacitated by that same source again for 24 hours. If presented with everything it needs to complete its unfinished business, the ghost permanently dies after completing it.

fields.name: Hungry Dead Nature
fields.desc: The ghoul doesn't require air or sleep. In addition, it must consume at least 2 pounds of raw meat every 24 hours, or it loses its immunity to exhaustion and risks starvation until it does so. While it has any levels of exhaustion from starvation, the ghoul can't remove levels of exhaustion until it consumes at least 4 pounds of raw meat.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The ghoul can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The ghoul is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Aberrant Ground
fields.desc: The ground within 10 feet of the mouther is dough-like difficult terrain. A creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Aberrant Resilience
fields.desc: The mouther is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

fields.name: Gibbering
fields.desc: The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't incapacitated. A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and that can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 13 WIS save or it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and must roll a d8 to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and moves its full speed in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The glabrezu is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The glabrezu has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Point Blank Grappler
fields.desc: When the glabrezu makes a Crackling Flame Bolt attack, it doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, provided it is grappling that creature.

fields.name: Brutal
fields.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The gnoll's Perception is 15 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the goat moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or be knocked prone.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the goat moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 STR save or be knocked prone.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the dragon moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the dragon can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The golmana is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing
fields.desc: The golmana's Perception is 19 when perceiving by hearing.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The golmana has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The golmana can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The gorgon is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Trampling Charge
fields.desc: If the gorgon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 16 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the gorgon can make one Hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Corrode Metal
fields.desc: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage. The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from ordinary fresh or curing mortar.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: The ooze doesn't require sleep.

fields.name: Ooze Resilience
fields.desc: The ooze is resistant to the grappled and restrained conditions, and it is immune to exhaustion and to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and prone conditions.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The ooze can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the dragon moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the dragon can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The hag can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Fey Resilience
fields.desc: The hag is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The hag can mimic Animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 WIS (Insight) check. Speak with Beasts. The hag can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The grick is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The grick can climb difficult surfaces, including upside ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Stone Camouflage
fields.desc: The grick's Stealth is 17 in rocky terrain.

fields.name: Heightened Sight
fields.desc: The griffon's Perception is 18 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The griffon is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The griffon has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the griffon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the griffon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claws attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the griffon can make one Beak attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The grimlock's Perception is 16 when perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Stone Camouflage
fields.desc: The grimlock's Stealth is 18 while in rocky terrain.

fields.name: Suppressed Senses
fields.desc: The grimlock can't use its keensense while deafened and unable to smell.

fields.name: Divine Strikes
fields.desc: The naga's weapon attacks are magical. When the naga hits with any weapon attack, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 necrotic damage or radiant damage (included in the attack), the naga's choice.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The naga is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Rejuvenation
fields.desc: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

fields.name: Inscrutable
fields.desc: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. WIS (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The sphinx is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Psychic Claws
fields.desc: The sphinx's Claw attacks are magical. When the sphinx hits with a Claw attack, the Claw deals an extra 3d6 psychic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The harpy is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Heightened Sight
fields.desc: The hawk's Perception is 19 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The hawk has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the hawk's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Heightened Sight
fields.desc: The hawk's Perception is 19 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Prey Sense
fields.desc: The hound can pinpoint, by scent, the location of Medium and smaller creatures within 30 feet of it.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The hezrou can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The hezrou is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The hezrou has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
fields.desc: The hezrou can communicate with frogs and toads as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The hezrou's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Stench
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the hezrou must succeed on a DC 16 CON save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature is immune to the hezrou's Stench for the next 24 hours.

fields.name: Giant Attributes
fields.desc: The hill giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

fields.name: Show of Might
fields.desc: The hill giant can use STR instead of CHA when making CHA (Intimidation) checks.

fields.name: Earth Glide
fields.desc: The hinn can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the hinn doesn't disturb the material through which it moves.

fields.name: Nebulous (Cloud Form Only)
fields.desc: The hinn's Stealth is 20, it can hover while flying, can't manipulate objects or attack, and it can pass through any space air can pass through without squeezing. In addition, it can enter and hide in any Tiny or larger container, such as a pouch, lamp, backpack, or barrel.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The hippocampus can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Shared Breath
fields.desc: The hippocampus's gills pull more air from the water than the hippocampus needs, expelling the excess as bubbles down its neck and across its back. If an air-breathing creature is riding the hippocampus, these bubbles can provide that creature a supply of fresh air when the hippocampus isn't in combat or traveling at a fast pace.

fields.name: Heightened Sight
fields.desc: The hippogriff's Perception is 18 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The hippogriff is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Collective Mind
fields.desc: The hivebound's individual insects and swarms under its control are connected via a hive mind. It can telepathically communicate with any of its individual insects and swarms within 1 mile of it, and it can't be surprised. It can have up to five swarms of insects under its control at a time.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The hivebound is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Reinforced Mind
fields.desc: If the hivebound starts its turn afflicted by an ongoing effect that allows a repeated INT, WIS, or CHA save to end the effect, such as the hold spell, the hivebound can make the save at the start of the turn instead of the end and has advantage on the save.

fields.name: Unshakable Command
fields.desc: Each friendly creature within 30 feet of the hobgoblin commander can't be charmed or frightened while the commander isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Bound Construct
fields.desc: The homunculus serves another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded and on the same plane of existence, the companion can sense what the homunculus senses and the two can communicate telepathically. While the homunculus is within 100 feet of the companion, it can use a reaction to deliver any spell the companion casts that has a range of touch. If the spell requires an attack roll, the homunculus uses the companion's spell attack modifier for the roll. While the homunculus is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion has advantage on INT (Arcana) and INT (Investigation) checks. At any time and for any reason, the homunculus can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The homunculus doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Construct Resilience
fields.desc: The homunculus is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: Devilish Resilience
fields.desc: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Devil's Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Draft Animal
fields.desc: The draft horse can push, drag, or lift weight in pounds equal to three times its carrying capacity.

fields.name: Easy Gait
fields.desc: The horse's steps are smooth and steady. A creature riding the horse has advantage on saves against exhaustion caused by a Forced March.

fields.name: Trampling Charge
fields.desc: If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the horse can make another Hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The husk demon can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The husk demon is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The husk demon has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

fields.name: Multiple Heads
fields.desc:
The hydra has five heads and is resistant to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and unconscious conditions.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 HP for each head regrown in this way.

fields.name: Reactive Heads
fields.desc: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

fields.name: Wakeful
fields.desc: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

fields.name: Cackling Chorus
fields.desc: If three or more hyenas are all within 30 feet of each other, their cackling, grunts, whoops, and yips create a deafening chorus. A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of such a hyena must succeed on a CON save or be deafened until the start of its next turn. The DC is equal to 8 plus the number of participating hyenas.

fields.name: Cackling Chorus
fields.desc: If three or more hyenas are all within 30 feet of each other, their cackling, grunts, whoops, and yips create a deafening chorus. A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of such a hyena must succeed on a DC 10 CON save or be deafened until the start of its next turn. The DC is equal to 8 plus the number of participating hyenas.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The hyena has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the hyena's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Devilish Resilience
fields.desc: The devil is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Devil's Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Snow Walk
fields.desc: The devil can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. In addition, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

fields.name: Death Burst
fields.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of viscous ice. Each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 11 DEX save or be restrained by ice for 1 minute. A creature, including the restrained creature, can take its action to free the restrained creature by succeeding on a DC 11 STR check. The ice melts immediately if the restrained creature takes fire damage, freeing the creature.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary shard of ice.

fields.name: Devilish Resilience
fields.desc: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Devil's Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the imp's darkvision.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The imp has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Aberrant Resilience
fields.desc: The insatiable brood has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Bites
fields.desc: The insatiable brood's Bites attacks are magical.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The insatiable brood deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The insatiable brood can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the brood can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The brood can't regain HP or gain temporary HP.

fields.name: Swarm Resilience
fields.desc: The swarm is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it is immune to the charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, and stunned conditions.

fields.name: Void Dweller
fields.desc: The insatiable brood doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it is immune to the effects of Void terrain. In addition, it can fly through the Void as if through air.

fields.name: Illumination
fields.desc: The beetle sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

fields.name: Crawling Swarm
fields.desc: A creature in the swarm's space is covered in crawling and buzzing insects. If the creature casts a spell with a somatic component, it must succeed on a DC 11 CON save or the spell fails to cast, expending the action required to cast it but not the spell slot or daily use.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain HP or gain temporary HP.

fields.name: Swarm Resilience
fields.desc: The swarm is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it is immune to the charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, and stunned conditions.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The invisible stalker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Elemental Resilience
fields.desc: The stalker is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Faultless Tracker
fields.desc: At the end of each long rest, the invisible stalker can choose a creature it knows or has seen to be its quarry. A stalker summoned by another creature can choose only the quarry specified by its summoner, but the stalker also knows the location of its summoner while it continues to serve the summoner. The stalker always knows the direction and distance to its quarry, provided the two are on the same plane of existence.

fields.name: Invisibility
fields.desc: The stalker is invisible. The condition's effect on DEX (Stealth) checks has been included in the above Stealth value.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Fire Absorption
fields.desc: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains HP equal to the fire damage dealt.

fields.name: Golem Resilience
fields.desc: The golem is immune to poison and psychic damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: Warrior Stance
fields.desc:
At the start of each of its turns, the iron golem chooses one of the following fighting stances to adopt, which lasts until the start of the golem's next turn.
- **Retributive.** The next time the golem is hit by a melee weapon attack from a creature within 5 feet of it before the start of its next turn, the golem can slam its shoulder into the attacker as a reaction. The attacker must succeed on a DC 18 STR save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the golem and knocked prone.
- **Aggressive.** When the golem uses Multiattack, it can replace one additional Spear Arm attack with a Shield Bash attack. If it does so, its AC is reduced by 2 until the start of its next turn.
- **Defensive.** The golem's AC increases by 4, but it can't make Shield Bash attacks until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The jackal's Perception is 18 when perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The jackal has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the jackal's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Chivalrous Presence
fields.desc:
The knight exudes a powerful presence. At the start of each of the knight's turns, it chooses one of the following presences, which lasts until the start of the knight's next turn.
- **Empowering Presence.** Each friendly creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the knight has advantage on the first attack roll it makes before this presence ends.
- **Protective Presence.** Hostile creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against friendly creatures within 5 feet of the knight.
- **Unwavering Presence.** Each friendly creature within 15 feet of the knight is resistant to the charmed and frightened conditions.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 7 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 7 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 3 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The kraken can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Freedom of Movement
