fields.desc: The kraken ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the kraken fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The kraken is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Badlands Strider
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of sand, mud, or rock doesn't cost the lamia extra movement. In addition, the lamia leaves no tracks or other traces of its passage when moving through sandy, muddy, or rocky terrain.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The lamia is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Aberrant Resilience
fields.desc: The lantern hagfish is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

fields.name: Bioluminescent Slime
fields.desc: The lantern hagfish sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The hagfish can alter the radius as a bonus action. In addition, the hagfish has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one other hagfish is within 5 feet of the creature and that other hagfish isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Void Dweller
fields.desc: The lantern hagfish doesn't require air or sleep, and it is immune to the effects of Void terrain. In addition, it can swim through the Void as if through water.

fields.name: Devilish Resilience
fields.desc: The devil is resistant to cold damage. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Devil's Sight
fields.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the lemure's darkvision.

fields.name: Hellish Rejuvenation
fields.desc: Unlike other outsiders, a lemure that dies in its home plane of the Hells is restored in a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears in the Hells within 1 mile of where it was slain. Only sprinkling holy water on the lemure's remains can prevent this trait from functioning.

fields.name: Arcane Mastery
fields.desc: The lich can concentrate on two spells simultaneously. If it casts a third spell that requires concentration, the lich loses concentration on the oldest spell. If the lich is concentrating on two spells and loses concentration because of taking damage, it loses concentration only on the oldest spell.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the lich fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Rejuvenation
fields.desc: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

fields.name: Turn Resistance
fields.desc: The lich has advantage on saves against any effect that turns undead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The lich doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The lich is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The lion's Perception is 18 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The lion has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the lion's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the lion moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claws attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the lion can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Running Leap
fields.desc: With a 10-foot running start, the lion can long jump up to 25 feet.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The living colossus doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Construct Resilience
fields.desc: The living colossus is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the living colossus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statue or monument of the individual it represents.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The living colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The living colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Brutal
fields.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the lizardfolk ruler hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Heightened Smell and Taste
fields.desc: The lizardfolk's Perception is 17 when perceiving by smell or taste.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The lizardfolk ruler can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

fields.name: Unshakable Command
fields.desc: Each friendly creature within 30 feet of the lizardfolk ruler can't be charmed or frightened while the ruler isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Heightened Smell and Taste
fields.desc: The lizardfolk's Perception is 20 when perceiving by smell or taste.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The lizardfolk shaman can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

fields.name: Heightened Smell and Taste
fields.desc: The lizardfolk's Perception is 18 when perceiving by smell or taste.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

fields.name: Arcane Weapons
fields.desc: The mage apprentice's weapon attacks are magical. When the mage hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d8 force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Reckless Show-Off
fields.desc: If it can see a fellow apprentice or its magical teacher at the start of its turn, the mage apprentice has advantage on the first spell attack roll it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it also have advantage until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Arcane Weapons
fields.desc: The mage's weapon attacks are magical. When the mage hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The mage has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Death Burst
fields.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of lava. Each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 11 DEX save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the mephit, knocked prone, and catch on fire. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the creature on fire takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary mound of molten rock.

fields.name: Death Burst
fields.desc: When the magmin dies, it collapses into a Tiny cinder cone. On initiative count 20 after the magmin dies, the cinder cone erupts in a burst of fire and lava. Each creature within 10 feet of the cone must make a DC 11 DEX save, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried in that area are ignited.

fields.name: Hardened Magma
fields.desc: While the magmin isn't ablaze, it is resistant to piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, and it is vulnerable to thunder damage.

fields.name: Molten Body
fields.desc: While the magmin is ablaze, each creature that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Trampling Charge
fields.desc: If the mammoth moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 17 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the mammoth can make one Stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The manticore can mimic Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 13 WIS (Insight) check.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The manticore is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
fields.desc: The manticore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The marilith is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Flaming Weapons
fields.desc: The marilith's weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 fire damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The marilith has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Reactive
fields.desc: The marilith gets up to five extra reactions, but these extra reactions can be used only for Parry.

fields.name: Tools of the Trade
fields.desc: The master alchemist is proficient with alchemist's supplies and doubles its proficiency bonus for any ability check it makes with alchemist's supplies.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The mastiff's Perception is 16 when perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Tools of the Trade
fields.desc: The mechanist is proficient with tinker tools and doubles its proficiency bonus for any ability check it makes with tinker tools.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The medusa is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Petrifying Gaze
fields.desc:
When a creature that can see the medusa's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a DC 14 CON save if the medusa isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the save fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the save at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on itself on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.
Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the save at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the medusa sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the medusa, due to its curse, is affected by its own gaze. A medusa isn't resistant to its own gaze.

fields.name: Snake Friend
fields.desc: The medusa can communicate with snakes as if they shared a language, and snakes can't be petrified by the medusa's Petrifying Gaze.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The merrow can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The merrow is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
fields.desc: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

fields.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
fields.desc: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

fields.name: Grappler
fields.desc: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The mimic is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the minotaur skeleton moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the skeleton and knocked prone.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the minotaur skeleton remains motionless and prone, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate minotaur skeleton.

fields.name: Labyrinthine Memories
fields.desc: The minotaur skeleton has advantage on checks and saves to avoid becoming lost or to recall a path it has previously traveled.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The skeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The skeleton is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the minotaur and knocked prone.

fields.name: Labyrinthine Recall
fields.desc: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The minotaur is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Reckless
fields.desc: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The minotaur deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The mire fiend can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The mire fiend is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The mire fiend has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The mire fiend has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the mire fiend's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Swamp Camouflage
fields.desc: The mire fiend's Stealth is 21 while in swampy terrain.

fields.name: Aberrant Resilience
fields.desc: The mordovermis is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

fields.name: Sinuous Form
fields.desc: The mordovermis can easily move through any opening large enough for a Small creature. It can squeeze through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The mordovermis's destination must still have suitable room to accommodate its volume.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the mordovermis has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 9 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Beast of Burden
fields.desc: The mule is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the mummy lord fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The mummy lord has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Rejuvenation
fields.desc: A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the mummy lord's heart.

fields.name: Turning Defiance
fields.desc: The mummy lord and any friendly Undead within 30 feet of it have advantage on saves against effects that turn undead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The mummy lord doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The mummy lord is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The mummy doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The mummy is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Fungal Toxicity
fields.desc: A creature that hits the mycolid with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 CON save or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the poison isn't neutralized before 1 hour has passed, the creature must succeed on a DC 13 CON save, taking 5 (2d4) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

fields.name: Mycolid Connection
fields.desc: The mycolid can pinpoint the location of each friendly mycolid within 120 feet of it. In addition, its telepathy range increases to 120 feet when communicating with other mycolids.

fields.name: Plant Resilience
fields.desc: The mycolid is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Fungal Toxicity
fields.desc: A creature that hits the mycolid with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 CON save or be poisoned for 5 hours. If the poison isn't neutralized before 5 hours have passed, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 CON save, taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

fields.name: Mycolid Connection
fields.desc: The spore lord can pinpoint the location of each friendly mycolid within 1 mile of it. In addition, its telepathy range increases to 1 mile when communicating with other mycolids.

fields.name: Plant Resilience
fields.desc: The mycolid is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The nalfeshnee is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Horrific Nimbus
fields.desc: The nalfeshnee magically emits scintillating, multicolored light that disorients and frightens mortals. Each creature that isn't an Aberration, Celestial, or Fiend and that starts its turn within 15 feet of the nalfeshnee must succeed on a DC 16 WIS save or be frightened until the start of its next turn. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more must take the Dash action on its turn and move away from the nalfeshnee by the safest available route, unless there is nowhere to move.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The nalfeshnee has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The hag has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Illumination
fields.desc: The nightmare sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

fields.name: Riding Flames
fields.desc: Any creature riding a willing nightmare is resistant to fire damage. A creature riding the nightmare without the nightmare's permission takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of the nightmare's turns.

fields.name: Impenetrable Ego
fields.desc: While the noble is conscious and wearing no armor and wielding no shield, it adds its CHA modifier to its AC (included above). In addition, it is resistant to the charmed and frightened conditions.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The ochre jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Ooze Nature
fields.desc: The ochre jelly doesn't require sleep.

fields.name: Ooze Resilience
fields.desc: The ochre jelly is resistant to the restrained condition, and it is immune to exhaustion and to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and prone conditions.

fields.name: Overwhelming Stench
fields.desc: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the ochre jelly must succeed on a DC 13 CON save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it must spend its turn retching uncontrollably and be unable to move or act.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The ochre jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

fields.name: Underwater Camouflage
fields.desc: The octopus's Stealth is 18 while underwater.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

fields.name: Underwater Camouflage
fields.desc: The octopus's Stealth is 18 while underwater.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Undead Fortitude
fields.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 HP, it must make a CON save with a DC equal to 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 HP instead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The zombie is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Giant Attributes
fields.desc: The ogre is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

fields.name: Empowered Weapons
fields.desc: The oni's weapon attacks are magical. When the oni hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d6 force damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Giant Attributes
fields.desc: The oni is resistant to the stunned condition.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The oni regains 10 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP.

fields.name: Martial Adept
fields.desc: A melee or ranged weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the orc warlord hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Stalwart
fields.desc: As the **orc**.

fields.name: Stalwart
fields.desc: If the orc starts its turn afflicted by an ongoing effect that allows for a repeated save to end the effect, such as the hold spell or the poison from an ettercap's Bite, the orc can make the save at the start of the turn instead of the end and has advantage on the save.

fields.name: Echolocation
fields.desc: The orca can't use its keensense while deafened.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing
fields.desc: The orca's Perception is 18 when perceiving by hearing.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The orca can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

fields.name: Aberrant Resilience
fields.desc: The otyugh is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

fields.name: Limited Telepathy
fields.desc: The otyugh can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

fields.name: Stench
fields.desc: Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the otyugh must succeed on a DC 15 CON save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The owl doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Sight
fields.desc: The owl's Perception is 20 when perceiving by hearing or sight.

fields.name: Quiet Wings
fields.desc: The owl's Stealth is 19 while flying.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The owl doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Sight
fields.desc: The owl's Perception is 18 when perceiving by hearing or sight.

fields.name: Quiet Wings
fields.desc: The owl's Stealth is 18 while flying.

fields.name: Glide
fields.desc: The owlbear has long, sturdy feathers along its forelimbs and sides that expand while falling to slow its rate of descent to 60 feet per round, landing on its feet and taking no falling damage. It can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it falls. The owlbear can't gain height with its gliding feathers alone. If subjected to a strong wind or lift of any kind, it can use the updraft to glide farther.

fields.name: Heightened Sight and Smell
fields.desc: The owlbear's Perception is 18 when perceiving by sight or smell.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The owlbear is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The panther's Perception is 19 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the panther moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the panther can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Celestial Resilience
fields.desc: The pegasus is resistant to radiant damage.

fields.name: Diving Pounce
fields.desc: If the pegasus is flying and moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the pegasus can make one Hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The pegasus has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: The pegasus's weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: Ethereal Sight
fields.desc: The phase spider can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The phase spider is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Web Walker
fields.desc: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

fields.name: Aura of the Devil Lord
fields.desc: Each hostile creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the pit fiend must succeed on a DC 21 WIS save or be frightened until the start of its next turn. Each friendly devil within 20 feet of the pit fiend is immune to the charmed and frightened conditions and has advantage on the first attack roll it makes on each of its turns.

fields.name: Devilish Resilience
fields.desc: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Flaming Weapons
fields.desc: The pit fiend's weapon attacks are magical. When the fiend hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d6 fire damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The pit fiend has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Angelic Resilience
fields.desc: The planetar is resistant to radiant damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed and frightened conditions.

fields.name: Angelic Senses
fields.desc: The planetar can pinpoint the location of Aberrations, Celestials, Fiends, and Undead within 30 feet of it and knows if a place or object it can sense is consecrated or desecrated.

fields.name: Angelic Weapons
fields.desc: The planetar's weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 7d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Divine Awareness
fields.desc: The planetar knows if it hears a lie.

fields.name: Divine Protection
fields.desc: Aberrations, Celestials, Fiends, and Undead have disadvantage on attack rolls against the planetar.

fields.name: Immortal Nature
fields.desc: The planetar doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The planetar has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Hardy
fields.desc: Any critical hit against the dinosaur becomes a normal hit.

fields.name: Hold Breath
fields.desc: The plesiosaurus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

fields.name: Draft Animal
fields.desc: The draft horse can push, drag, or lift weight in pounds equal to three times its carrying capacity.

fields.name: Divine Blessing
fields.desc: The priest is resistant to necrotic damage or radiant damage, as appropriate for the priest's deity.

fields.name: Divine Weapons
fields.desc: The priest's weapons are shrouded in dark or golden flames, as appropriate for the priest's deity. When the priest hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage or radiant damage (included in the attack), the priest's choice.

fields.name: Heightened Senses
fields.desc: The pseudodragon's Perception is 18 when perceiving by sight, hearing, or smell.

fields.name: Limited Telepathy
fields.desc: The pseudodragon can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 feet of it that can understand a language.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The pseudodragon has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The purple worm is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Tunneler
fields.desc: The purple worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed, and it leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The quasit is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The quasit has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Blood Frenzy
fields.desc: The swarm has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its HP.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The swarm's Perception is 15 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Swarm

fields.name: Swarm Resilience
fields.desc: The swarm is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it is immune to the charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, and stunned conditions.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The swarm can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Blood Frenzy
fields.desc: The quipper has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its HP.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The quipper's Perception is 13 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The quipper can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Limited Magic Immunity
fields.desc: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saves against all other spells and magical effects.

fields.name: Accustomed to Filth
fields.desc: The rat has advantage on saves against contracting diseases.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The rat's Perception is 15 while perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The rat has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the rat's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Accustomed to Filth

fields.desc: The swarm's Perception is 15 when perceiving by smell.
