fields.name: Accustomed to Filth
fields.desc: The rat has advantage on saves against contracting diseases.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The rat's Perception is 15 while perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Carrion Sense
fields.desc: The swarm can pinpoint, by scent, the location of carrion, dead creatures, and Undead without the Incorporeal Movement trait within 60 feet of it.

fields.name: Pilfering Swarm
fields.desc: A creature in the swarm's space is surrounded by ravens pecking and pulling at its clothing, hair, fur, and belongings. If a creature in the swarm's space casts a spell with a material component, it must succeed on a DC 12 DEX save or the spell fails to cast, expending the action required to cast it but not the spell slot or daily use, as the ravens steal the component.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny raven. The swarm can't regain HP or gain temporary HP.

fields.name: Swarm Resilience
fields.desc: The swarm is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it is immune to the charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, and stunned conditions.

fields.name: Carrion Sense
fields.desc: The raven can pinpoint, by scent, the location of carrion, dead creatures, and Undead without the Incorporeal Movement trait within 60 feet of it.

fields.name: Mimicry
fields.desc: The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a chord of a flute melody, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 WIS (Insight) check.

fields.name: Recollection
fields.desc: The raven knows up to 20 words in any language it has heard and can repeat those words in the voices it heard them, using its Mimicry trait.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the dragon moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the dragon can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Heated Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the remorhaz or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The remorhaz is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Tunneler
fields.desc: The remorhaz can burrow through ice, snow, and permafrost, and it leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the rhinoceros moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 STR save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the rhinoceros and knocked prone.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The drone doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Construct Resilience
fields.desc: The drone is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: Electrical Malfunction
fields.desc: Whenever the drone takes lightning damage, it must succeed on a DC 11 WIS save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Point-Blank Shots
fields.desc: When the drone makes a ranged attack, it doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, though it may still have disadvantage from other sources.

fields.name: Heightened Sight
fields.desc: The roc's Perception is 19 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The roc is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Seabird
fields.desc: The roc can swim up to 60 feet on its turn, but it must start and end its movement either flying or on a solid surface, such as a ship or beach. If it is swimming at the end of its turn, it must succeed on a DC 19 CON save or it immediately begins to sink and suffocate. A suffocating roc must succeed on a DC 19 STR check to fly out of the substance where it is sinking.

fields.name: Climbing Tendrils
fields.desc: If at least four of the roper's Grasping Tendrils aren't grappling creatures, the roper has a climbing speed of 30 feet.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal conical or spire-like cave formation, such as a stalagmite or stalactite.

fields.name: Grasping Tendrils
fields.desc: The roper can have up to six Grasping Tendrils at a time. Each Grasping Tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 HP; vulnerable to thunder damage; immune to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a Grasping Tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A Grasping Tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 STR check against it.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The roper is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
fields.desc: The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by _dispel magic_, the rug must succeed on a CON save against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The rug doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Construct Resilience
fields.desc: The rug is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: Damage Transfer
fields.desc: While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the rug remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal rug.

fields.name: Iron Scent
fields.desc: The rust monster can pinpoint, by scent, the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The rust monster is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Rust Metal
fields.desc: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the rust monster is destroyed after dealing damage.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The rust monster can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Blood Frenzy
fields.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its HP.

fields.name: Limited Amphibiousness
fields.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

fields.name: Shark Telepathy
fields.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

fields.name: Heated Body
fields.desc: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Heated Weapons
fields.desc: When the salamander hits with a metal melee weapon, the weapon deals an extra 7 (2d6) fire damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Void Strength
fields.desc: The satarre is resistant to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Void Weapons
fields.desc: The satarre's weapon attacks are magical. When the satarre hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Fey Resilience
fields.desc: The satyr is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The satyr has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Heat Shimmer
fields.desc: Creatures more than 30 feet from the scorch drake have disadvantage on WIS (Perception) checks to see the drake.

fields.name: Scalding Blood
fields.desc: A creature that hits the scorch drake with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the drake takes 3 (1d6) fire damage and must succeed on a DC 15 DEX save or ignite. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, an ignited creature takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Sight
fields.desc: The scout's Perception is 18 when perceiving by hearing or sight.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The sea hag can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Fey Resilience
fields.desc: The sea hag is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Horrific Appearance
fields.desc: When a Humanoid that can see the hag's true form starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag, the hag can force it to make a DC 12 WIS save. On a failure, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. Unless surprised or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, such as the ending of Illusory Appearance, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the save at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the hag until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the hag in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

fields.name: Underwater Camouflage
fields.desc: The hag's Stealth is 18 while underwater and not using Illusory Appearance.

fields.name: Charge
fields.desc: If the seahorse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 STR save or be knocked prone.

fields.name: Underwater Camouflage
fields.desc: The seahorse's Stealth is 19 while underwater.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The seahorse can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Underwater Camouflage
fields.desc: The seahorse's Stealth is 17 while underwater.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The seahorse can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Amorphous
fields.desc: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The shadow can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Sunlight Weakness
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saves.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The shadow doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The shadow is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Lightning Absorption
fields.desc: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

fields.name: Plant Resilience
fields.desc: The shambling mound is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Rotting Vegetation
fields.desc: The shambling mound emits the smell of rotting vegetation. A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the shambling mound must succeed on a DC 14 CON save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Blood Frenzy
fields.desc: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its HP.

fields.name: Blood Sense
fields.desc: The shark can pinpoint, by scent, the location of creatures that don't have all of their HP within 120 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

fields.name: Electrical Sensitivity
fields.desc: Whenever the shark takes lightning damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 CON save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The shark can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Blood Frenzy
fields.desc: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its HP.

fields.name: Blood Sense
fields.desc: The shark can pinpoint, by scent, the location of creatures that don't have all of their HP within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

fields.name: Electrical Sensitivity
fields.desc: Whenever the shark takes lightning damage, it must succeed on a DC 12 CON save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The shark can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Blood Sense
fields.desc: The shark can pinpoint, by scent, the location of creatures that don't have all of their HP within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

fields.name: Electrical Sensitivity
fields.desc: Whenever the shark takes lightning damage, it must succeed on a DC 11 CON save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The shark has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the shark's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Water Breathing
fields.desc: The shark can breathe only underwater.

fields.name: Bound
fields.desc: The shield guardian is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet's wearer, and the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian, teleporting the guardian to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the wearer after 1 minute. In addition, if the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is taken by the guardian instead.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The shield guardian doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Construct Resilience
fields.desc: The shield guardian is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The shield guardian regains 10 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP.

fields.name: Spell Storing
fields.desc: A spellcaster who wears the shield guardian's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell, using the appropriate action required by the spell, with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the shrieker remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

fields.name: Plant Resilience
fields.desc: The shrieker is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The sila can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Fluid Body (Bipedal Form Only)
fields.desc: The sila can move through the space of any creature, regardless of size, and a creature of any size can move through a sila's space. In addition, the sila can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Nebulous (Cloud Form Only)
fields.desc: The sila's Stealth is 21, it can hover while flying, can't manipulate objects or attack, and it can pass through any space air or water can pass through without squeezing. In addition, it can enter and hide in any Tiny or larger container, such as a pouch, lamp, backpack, or barrel.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the dragon moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the dragon can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the skeleton remains motionless and prone, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate Humanoid skeleton.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The skeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The skeleton is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing
fields.desc: The skullbloom's Perception is 16 while perceiving by hearing.

fields.name: Plant Resilience
fields.desc: The skullbloom is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Flyby
fields.desc: The snake doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

fields.name: Poisonous Swarm
fields.desc: The hissing, spitting, and constant nipping of snakes in the swarm leaves the swarm's space dripping with poison. A creature that starts its turn in the swarm's space must succeed on a DC 14 CON save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Swarm
fields.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny snake. The swarm can't regain HP or gain temporary HP.

fields.name: Swarm Resilience
fields.desc: The swarm is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it is immune to the charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, and stunned conditions.

fields.name: Angelic Resilience
fields.desc: The solar is resistant to radiant damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed and frightened conditions.

fields.name: Angelic Senses
fields.desc: The solar can pinpoint the location of Aberrations, Celestials, Fiends, and Undead within 30 feet of it and knows if a place or object it can sense is consecrated or desecrated.

fields.name: Angelic Weapons
fields.desc: The solar's weapon attacks are magical. When the solar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 6d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Divine Awareness
fields.desc: The solar knows if it hears a lie.

fields.name: Divine Protection
fields.desc: Aberrations, Celestials, Fiends, and Undead have disadvantage on attack rolls against the solar.

fields.name: Immortal Nature
fields.desc: The solar doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the solar fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The solar has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 5 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The specter doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The specter is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Standing Leap
fields.desc: The spider's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Web Sense
fields.desc: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

fields.name: Web Walker
fields.desc: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Web Sense
fields.desc: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

fields.name: Web Walker
fields.desc: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

fields.name: Guardian Projection
fields.desc: The spirit naga's skeletal form is covered with a magical illusion that makes it look like the guardian naga it was in life. The naga can use a bonus action to dismiss this illusion until the end of its next turn. The changes wrought by this illusion fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, a creature touching the spirit naga would feel its rough, dry scales and exposed bones instead of the smooth, cool scales of a guardian naga. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 INT (Investigation) check to discern the spirit naga's true appearance.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The naga is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Necrotic Strikes
fields.desc: The naga's weapon attacks are magical. When the naga hits with any weapon attack, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

fields.name: Rejuvenation
fields.desc: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

fields.name: Fey Resilience
fields.desc: The sprite is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
fields.desc: The sprite can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Aberrant Resilience
fields.desc: The star crow is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

fields.name: Illumination
fields.desc: The star crow sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

fields.name: Death Burst
fields.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a cloud of steam. Each creature within 5 feet of the mephit must succeed on a DC 11 DEX save or be scalded for 1 minute. A scalded creature has disadvantage on weapon attack rolls and on ability checks that require manual dexterity. A scalded creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the mephit remains motionless and hovering, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary cloud of steam.

fields.name: Giant Attributes
fields.desc: The stone giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

fields.name: Stone Camouflage
fields.desc: The giant's Stealth is 20 while in rocky terrain.

fields.name: Construct Nature
fields.desc: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Golem Resilience
fields.desc: The golem is immune to poison and psychic damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

fields.name: Immutable Form
fields.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The giant can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Giant Attributes
fields.desc: The giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

fields.name: Influence Weather
fields.desc: Nearby weather responds to the storm giant's desires. At the start of each minute, the storm giant can choose to change the precipitation, temperature, and wind within 3 miles of it by one stage, up or down (no action required). This effect works like the changing weather conditions aspect of the control weather spell, except the conditions change immediately and the storm giant can't change the temperature by more than one stage up or down from the area's standard temperature.

fields.name: Stormsight
fields.desc: The storm giant can see through areas obscured by clouds, fog, rain, snow, and storms without penalty.

fields.name: Updraft
fields.desc: While in an area open to the sky, the storm giant has a flying speed of 30 feet.

fields.name: Telepathic Bond
fields.desc: The succubus ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has charmed. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the tarrasque fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The tarrasque has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The tarrasque is resistant to exhaustion.

fields.name: Reflective Hide
fields.desc: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

fields.name: Siege Behemoth
fields.desc: The tarrasque deals triple damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Brutal
fields.desc: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the thug hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The thug has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the thug's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The tiger's Perception is 18 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claws attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one Claws attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The tiger's Perception is 18 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claws attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the treant remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

fields.name: Plant Resilience
fields.desc: The treant is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Siege Monster
fields.desc: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

fields.name: Speak with Plants
fields.desc: The treant can communicate with Plants and nonmagical plants as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Hardy
fields.desc: Any critical hit against the dinosaur becomes a normal hit.

fields.name: Trampling Charge
fields.desc: If the triceratops moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the triceratops can make one Stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Giant Attributes
fields.desc: The troll is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The troll's Perception is 17 while perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The troll regains 10 HP at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 HP and doesn't regenerate.

fields.name: Hardy
fields.desc: Any critical hit against the dinosaur becomes a normal hit.

fields.name: Celestial Resilience
fields.desc: The unicorn is resistant to radiant damage.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The unicorn has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Magic Weapons
fields.desc: The unicorn's weapon attacks are magical.

fields.name: Sense the Unnatural
fields.desc: The unicorn can pinpoint the location of Aberrations and Undead within 60 feet of it.

fields.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
fields.desc: The unicorn can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

fields.name: Woodland Walk
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of nonmagical plants doesn't cost the unicorn extra movement. In addition, the unicorn can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The unska is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The unska has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Hungry Dead Nature
fields.desc: As the **vampire**.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The vampire spawn regains 10 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

fields.name: Resting Place
fields.desc: As the **vampire**.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: As the **vampire**.

fields.name: Vampire Weaknesses
fields.desc: As the **vampire**.

fields.name: Vampiric Resilience
fields.desc: The vampire is immune to exhaustion.

fields.name: Blood-Bound
fields.desc: If the thrall has not consumed 1 ounce of blood from a vampire within the past week, it is poisoned for 1 week, and it loses darkvision and its Limited Regeneration, Spider Climb, and Sunlight Sensitivity traits until it consumes 1 ounce of vampire blood.

fields.name: Limited Regeneration
fields.desc: The thrall regains 2 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP and isn't in sunlight. If the thrall takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the thrall's next turn.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The thrall can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the thrall has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 8 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Hungry Dead Nature
fields.desc: The vampire doesn't require air or sleep. In addition, it must consume at least 80 ounces of blood (approximately half the blood in a Medium Humanoid's body) every 24 hours, or it loses its immunity to exhaustion and risks starvation until it does so. While it has any levels of exhaustion from starvation, the vampire can't remove levels of exhaustion until it consumes at least 160 ounces of blood.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the vampire fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Misty Escape
fields.desc: When it drops to 0 HP outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Mist Form bonus action) instead of falling unconscious, provided it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed. While it has 0 HP in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 HP. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 HP, it regains 1 HP.

fields.name: Regeneration
fields.desc: The vampire regains 20 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

fields.name: Resting Place
fields.desc: The vampire has a coffin, grave, sarcophagus, or similar location just large enough for it to lie down designated as its resting place. While in its resting place, the vampire doesn't suffer exhaustion levels from starvation and has keensense out to a range of 120 feet.

fields.name: Spider Climb
fields.desc: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

fields.name: Stake to the Heart
fields.desc: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed.

fields.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
fields.desc: The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

fields.name: Vampire Weaknesses
fields.desc:
The vampire has the following flaws:
- **Forbiddance.** The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
- **Harmed by Running Water.** The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

fields.name: Vampiric Resilience
fields.desc: The vampire is immune to exhaustion.

fields.name: Hardy
fields.desc: Any critical hit against the dinosaur becomes a normal hit.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The velociraptor has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the violet fungus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

fields.name: Plant Resilience
fields.desc: The violet fungus is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
fields.desc: If the lich fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

fields.name: Rejuvenation
fields.desc: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

fields.name: Turn Resistance
fields.desc: The lich has advantage on saves against any effect that turns undead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The lich doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The lich is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Versatile Artist
fields.desc: At the end of each long rest, the lich chooses one form of artistic expression, such as song, poetry, dance, fashion, paint, or similar. Until it finishes a long rest, the lich has immunity to one type of damage, which is associated with its artistic expression. For example, a lich expressing art through song or poetry has immunity to thunder damage, a lich expressing art through fashion has immunity to slashing damage, and a lich expressing art through paint has immunity to acid damage. This trait can't give the lich immunity to force, psychic, or radiant damage.

fields.name: Demonic Resilience
fields.desc: The vrock is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Magic Resistance
fields.desc: The vrock has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

fields.name: Carrion Sense
fields.desc: The vulture can pinpoint, by scent, the location of carrion, dead creatures, and Undead without the Incorporeal Movement trait within 60 feet of it.

fields.name: Heightened Sight and Smell
fields.desc: The vulture's Perception is 18 when perceiving by sight or smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The vulture has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the vulture's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Carrion Sense
fields.desc: The vulture can pinpoint, by scent, the location of carrion, dead creatures, and Undead without the Incorporeal Movement trait within 60 feet of it.

fields.name: Heightened Sight and Smell
fields.desc: The vulture's Perception is 18 when perceiving by sight or smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The vulture has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the vulture's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: False Appearance
fields.desc: While the war horse skeleton remains motionless and prone, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate war horse skeleton.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The skeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The skeleton is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Elemental Nature
fields.desc: The elemental doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Elemental Resilience
fields.desc: The elemental is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Freeze
fields.desc: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes, and its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

fields.name: Purify Water
fields.desc: If the water elemental sits in a body of slow-flowing or standing water, such as a spring, small creek, or lake, for at least 1 hour, the water becomes purified and rendered free of poison and disease. In slow-flowing water, this purification fades 1 hour after the elemental leaves the water. In standing water, this purification lasts until a contaminant enters the water while the elemental isn't in it.

fields.name: Water Camouflage
fields.desc: The water elemental's Stealth is 17 while in a Medium or larger body of water.

fields.name: Water Form
fields.desc: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The weasel's Perception is 18 when perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The weasel's Perception is 18 when perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The werebear's Perception is 19 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Charge (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
fields.desc: If the wereboar moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Slam or Tusks attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage of the weapon's type. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or be knocked prone.

fields.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
fields.desc: If the wereboar takes 14 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 HP, it is reduced to 1 HP instead.

fields.name: Heightened Smell
fields.desc: The wererat's Perception is 17 when perceiving by smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The wererat has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wererat's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The weretiger's Perception is 18 when perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Pounce (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
fields.desc: If the weretiger moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the weretiger can make one Bite or Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The werewolf's Perception is 17 while perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The werewolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the werewolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Ice Walk
fields.desc: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. In addition, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

fields.name: Pounce
fields.desc: If the dragon moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 STR save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the dragon can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

fields.name: Martial Adept
fields.desc: A manufactured weapon, such as a sword or bow, deals one extra die of its damage when the wight hits with it (included in the attack).

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 8 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The wight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The wight is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Home in the Wilds
fields.desc: The wild warrior automatically discerns true north when outside, and checks to follow its tracks in forest, grassland, hills, or mountain terrain have disadvantage, unless the wild warrior chooses to leave obvious signs of its passage.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The wild warrior has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the warrior's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Ephemeral
fields.desc: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything. In addition, it adds its WIS modifier to its AC (included above).

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The will-o'-wisp doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The will-o'-wisp is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Variable Illumination
fields.desc: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The winter wolf's Perception is 20 when perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The winter wolf is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The winter wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the winter wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Snow Camouflage
fields.desc: The winter wolf's Stealth is 18 while in snowy terrain.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The wolf's Perception is 18 when perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The wolf's Perception is 16 while perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Pack Tactics
fields.desc: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

fields.name: Plant Camouflage
fields.desc: The wood herald's Stealth is 18 while in any terrain with ample, obscuring plant life.

fields.name: Plant Resilience
fields.desc: The wood herald is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

fields.name: Woodland Walk
fields.desc: Difficult terrain composed of nonmagical plants doesn't cost the wood herald extra movement. In addition, the herald can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

fields.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
fields.desc: The worg's Perception is 19 while perceiving by hearing or smell.

fields.name: Monstrosity Resilience
fields.desc: The worg is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

fields.name: Incorporeal Movement
fields.desc: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

fields.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
fields.desc: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 7 when perceiving by sight.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The wraith doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The wraith is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

fields.name: Intuition
fields.desc: The wyrdling rolls two dice for initiative, taking the higher number. In addition, the wyrdling has advantage on WIS (Insight) checks.

fields.name: Read Fate
fields.desc: The wyrdling can spend 1 minute communing with fate on behalf of one creature that remains within 10 feet of it for the duration. The creature must ask a single question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. At the end of the minute, the wyrdling pronounces the result of the target's inquiry. This trait works like the divination spell, except it can't be used to answer a specific creature's question more than once every 3 days, regardless if the creature asks a different question.

fields.name: Clumsy
fields.desc: While not flying, the wyvern is vulnerable to the grappled, prone, and restrained conditions.

fields.name: Earth Glide
fields.desc: The xorn can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the xorn doesn't disturb the material through which it moves.

fields.name: Stone Camouflage
fields.desc: The xorn's Stealth is 18 while in rocky terrain.

fields.name: Treasure Sense
fields.desc: The xorn can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 60 feet of it.

fields.name: Acidic Vapors
fields.desc: After the black dragon uses its Acid Breath, acid clings to its mouth, throat, and nostrils for a time, evaporating as the dragon breathes. While the dragon's Acid Breath is unavailable, acidic vapors surround it, and each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 15 CON save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Charged Hide
fields.desc: When the blue dragon hasn't exhaled its Lightning Breath, the electric charge builds up across its body. While the dragon's Lightning Breath is available, it emits wild sparks of electricity, and each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 16 CON save or be incapacitated until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Suffocating Heat
fields.desc: After the brass dragon uses its Fire Breath, the air around it is devoid of moisture and lacking in breathable air. While the dragon's Fire Breath is unavailable, each creature that requires air to breathe, other than the dragon, and that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 14 CON save or begin suffocating. A creature that fails this save for two consecutive rounds falls unconscious until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Lightning Extraction
fields.desc: After the bronze dragon uses its Lightning Breath, its body begins recharging with lightning, pulling electricity from nearby creatures. While the dragon's Lightning Breath is unavailable, each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must make a DC 15 CON save. On a failure, a creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both.

fields.name: Corrosive Scales
fields.desc: When the copper dragon hasn't spit its Acid Breath, the acid built up within the dragon causes the patina on its scales to spread to weapons that strike it. While the dragon's Acid Breath is available, any weapon made of metal that hits the dragon corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If a nonmagical weapon's penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the dragon is destroyed after dealing damage. A magical weapon can't have a penalty greater than -5, and a magical weapon removes this penalty after 24 hours or after its attuned wielder finishes a long rest.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Golden Splendor
fields.desc: When the gold dragon hasn't unleashed its Fire Breath, its scales gleam and sparkle like molten gold or a pile of gold coins. While the dragon's Fire Breath is available, each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 17 CHA save or be charmed until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Amphibious
fields.desc: The dragon can breathe air and water.

fields.name: Hallucinogenic Gas
fields.desc: After the green dragon exhales its Poison Breath, wisps of poisonous gas laced with the alchemical taint that permeates the dragon's body linger around it. While the dragon's Poison Breath is unavailable, each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 14 WIS save or be terrified, as the gas causes the creature to experience frightful hallucinations. A terrified creature is frightened, and its speed is reduced to 0.

fields.name: Boil Over
fields.desc: When the red dragon hasn't unleashed its Fire Breath, the heat builds and rolls outward from it. While the dragon's Fire Breath is available, it emits immense heat, and each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 17 CON save or take 7 (2d6) fire damage.

fields.name: Freezing Fog
fields.desc: After the silver dragon uses its Cold Breath, freezing fog surrounds it. While the dragon's Cold Breath is unavailable, each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 17 CON save or be restrained until the start of its next turn.

fields.name: Ice Walk
fields.desc: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. In addition, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost it extra movement.

fields.name: Numbing Chill
fields.desc: When the white dragon hasn’t unleashed its Cold Breath, the cold builds up within it and ripples outward from it. While the dragon’s Cold Breath is available, it emits a numbing chill, and each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 15 CON save or its speed is reduced by 10 feet.

fields.name: Undead Fortitude
fields.desc: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 HP, it must make a CON save with a DC equal to 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 HP instead.

fields.name: Undead Nature
fields.desc: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

fields.name: Undead Resilience
fields.desc: The zombie is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.
